title: PHPforeachKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPforeachKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Print all of the values in an array: "; } ?> Definition and Usage The foreach keyword is used to create foreach loops, which loops through a block of code for each element in an array. Related Pages Read more about foreach loops in our PHP foreach Loop Tutorial . More Examples Example Print keys and values from an associative array: "35", "Ben" => "37", "Joe" => "43" ]; foreach($people as $person => $age) { echo "$person is $age years old"; echo "
"; } ?> ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example

"35", "Ben" => "37", "Joe" => "43" ]; foreach($people as $person => $age) { echo "$person is $age years old"; echo "
"; } ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPforeachKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPforeachKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPforeachKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
